intro: Jungia stuebelii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces small, tubular flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, often with contrasting markings. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to both indoor and outdoor gardens.
